title: NixOS Package PRs for exfatprogs, pam_u2f, diffutils, nixos, attr-2.5.1, gnugrep-3.7 packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for exfatprogs, pam_u2f, diffutils, nixos, attr-2.5.1, gnugrep-3.7 packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from https://github.com/exfatprogs/exfatprogs/releases.

meta.description for exfatprogs is: exFAT filesystem userspace utilities

meta.homepage for exfatprogs is: https://github.com/exfatprogs/exfatprogs

Updates performed
  • Version update
To inspect upstream changes

  • Release on GitHub

  • Compare changes on GitHub

Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 1.2.5 with grep in /nix/store/9kb7jn35zisk2vxn0izkl3flcd5hvsqj-exfatprogs-1.2.5
  • found 1.2.5 in filename of file in /nix/store/9kb7jn35zisk2vxn0izkl3flcd5hvsqj-exfatprogs-1.2.5
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
4 total rebuild path(s)

4 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath

exfatprogs
kdePackages.kpmcore
kdePackages.partitionmanager
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/9kb7jn35zisk2vxn0izkl3flcd5hvsqj-exfatprogs-1.2.5 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A exfatprogs https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/b053e443478b1a0632121d338e6928b0630232c8.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/b053e443478b1a0632121d338e6928b0630232c8#exfatprogs

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/9kb7jn35zisk2vxn0izkl3flcd5hvsqj-exfatprogs-1.2.5
ls -la /nix/store/9kb7jn35zisk2vxn0izkl3flcd5hvsqj-exfatprogs-1.2.5/bin

Pre-merge build results

We have automatically built all packages that will get rebuilt due to
this change.

This gives evidence on whether the upgrade will break dependent packages.
Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

items.title: exfatprogs: 1.2.4 -> 1.2.5

items.content_html:
Add a simple test that starts rss-bridge and tries to fetch the feed of a demo bridge. On success we know the system setup (web server, PHP) and rss-bridge are working fine. Internet access is avoided by using a demo bridge.

items.title: nixos/automx2: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

When enabling services.kanata on a running system using nixos-rebuild switch (or nixos-rebuild test), the kanata service may fail to start if hardware.uinput is not enabled before. Note that this issue never happens if you use nixos-rebuild boot to enable service.kanata.

kanata needs to use uinput, so the services.kanata module sets hardware.uinput.enable = true. The config of hardware.uinput is set by systemd-modules-load.service and systemd-udevd.service. These two systemd services are dependencies of sysinit.target. According to man systemd.special, systemd automatically adds dependencies of the types Requires= and After= for this target unit to all services. So the kanata service will run after these two services during boot. However, nixos-rebuild switch do not know the dependency and order between the kanata service and these two services, so the kanata service may fail to start.

This patch makes sysinit-reactivation.target depend on these two services so that the dependency and order of the kanata service and these two services are preserved by nixos-rebuild switch.

Ideally, sysinit-reactivation.target should depend on all "sysinit units". But that is beyond the scope of this PR.

Closes #317282

Things done

items.title: nixos/lemurs: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

  1. Some of the arg options in kubelet will be deprecated and should be merged into the config file.
  2. Flannel service should be modified to support IPv6.

Things done

  1. Add failSwapOn, extraConfig options in services.kubernetes.kubelet.
  2. Patch flannel service to support IPv6 via something like services.kubernetes.clusterCidr = "10.42.0.0/16,2001:cafe:42::/56";.
  3. Tested on my homelab.

items.title: nixos/zapret: init

items.content_html:
The passthru.tests on RKE2 packages didn't build any tests, which is probably why failing tests haven't been noticed. This assigns tests for the corresponding package in passthru.tests instead of just inheriting nixosTests.rke2, which should show that tests are actually failing.

Related issue: #330638

items.title: rke2: fix nixos tests

items.content_html:
Description of changes

  • use upstream service and scripts
  • switch to integrated-vtysh-config, abandon per-daemon config
  • use always daemon names in options (e.g. ospf -> ospfd)
  • zebra, mgmtd and staticd are always enabled
  • abandon vtyListenAddress, vtyListenPort options; use "options"/"extraOptions" instead
  • extend test to test staticd
  • pkgs.servers.frr: fix sbindir and remove FHS PATH

fixes: #316163

items.title: nixos/frr: refactor

items.content_html:
Description of changes

K3S provides the ability to configure containerd, described here. This PR adds the option containerdConfigTemplate to expose this.

You can use it to add any containerd config. In my case, I wanted to add extra runtimes in order to enable Kata containers.

items.title: nixos/keymapper: init module

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This is the alternative to #300235.

History:

  • 263a81e (Oct 22, 2019 by bjornfor) remote sudo support for nixos-rebuild, using SUDO_USER to detect whether the command was executed with sudo locally, and then automatically using sudo on the remote as well
  • 2c09cfc (Nov 7, 2019 by bjornfor) introduction of the --use-remote-sudo flag and removal of the magic SUDO_USER logic
  • ab10bac (Jan 21, 2020 by zimbatm) reintroduction of the magic behavior (discussion: ab10bac#r37023141)

I think it's reasonable to remove this, since it has no benefit other than saving a few keystrokes and can lead to nasty surprises, as has been the case with nixos-enter.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed

items.title: nixos-rebuild: ignore SUDO_USER

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This fixes the system.build.netbootRamdisk build when using modules/installer/netboot/netboot.nix.

The contents argument to makeInitrdNG has been reworked in e6c5442, but netbootRamdisk still used the old schema.

Related hydra jobs:
https://hydra.nixos.org/job/nixos/trunk-combined/nixos.tests.boot.biosNetboot.x86_64-linux
https://hydra.nixos.org/job/nixos/trunk-combined/nixos.tests.boot.uefiNetboot.x86_64-linux

items.title: nixos/netboot: Fix netbootRamdisk build

items.content_html:
Description of changes

I'm not sure why this got removed. Adding the after makes dae start up correctly after network has been setup. Without this dae would need a restart on every system startup to work correctly. Use the statements from the official service: https://github.com/daeuniverse/dae/blob/4717fa2cdcc5f8925c1759cbabf5cb0e2eaf7ed7/install/dae.service#L4C44-L5

items.title: nixos/dae: add service `after`

items.content_html:
Description of changes

When AOT Caching is enabled on the MacOS host, Rosetta will mount a caching daemon rosettad which can be run to do AOT translation.
